messages.subject: Sad day
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/10/02 5:34:03 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes: I am just heartsick. Reading about Christie Watts was
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/10/02 5:34:03 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

I am just heartsick.
Reading about Christie Watts was almost too much, her poor family. That is
awful.

And then all the stuff about that Christian website. I'm not even going
there. I know it will just make me feel horrible and there is nothing I can
do to stop it, other than loving the heck out of my kids and making sure they
don't ever do stupid, mean things to their children, at least that's the hope.
I just don't understand people that want to promote misery in this world.
Especially when you read about people like Christie and realize there is
enough misery and sadness without anyone trying to contribute! ugh.

Ren
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
And remember,
"A life lived in fear is a life half lived"
